Class Circle

  • java.lang.Object
    • Circle

  • public class Circle
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a circle.

    Invariant: myRadius must be greater than 0 AND myCenter must not be null AND myColor must not be null

    Version:
    Spring 2014
    Author:
    Alan Fowler

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.awt.Point DEFAULT_CENTER
      A default Point for the center of a Circle - (0, 0).
      private static java.awt.Color DEFAULT_COLOR
      A default Color to use when no other Color is specified - Color.BLACK.
      private static double DEFAULT_RADIUS
      A default radius to use when no other value is specified - 1.0 (unit circle).
      private java.awt.Point myCenter
      The center of this Circle.
      private java.awt.Color myColor
      The color of this Circle.
      private double myRadius
      The radius of this Circle.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Circle()
      Constructs a black unit circle centered at the origin.
      Circle(double theRadius, java.awt.Point theCenter, java.awt.Color theColor)
      Constructs a Circle at the specified location with the specified radius and specified color.

    • Method Summary

      Methods

      Calculates and returns the area of this Circle.

      Calculates and returns the circumference of this Circle.

      Calculates and returns the diameter of this Circle.

      java.awt.Color getColor()

      Sets the center of this Circle to the specified point.

      Sets the Color of this Circle to the specified value.
      void setRadius(double theRadius)
      Sets the radius of this Circle to the specified value.
      java.lang.String toString()
      The String representation of this Circle will be formatted as follows:
      Circle [radius=(current value), center=(current value), color=(current value)].

    • Constructor Detail

      • Circle

        public Circle(double theRadius,
      java.awt.Point theCenter,
      java.awt.Color theColor)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs a Circle at the specified location with the specified radius and specified color.

        Precondition: The parameters must not violate the class invariant. That is, theRadius must be greater than 0 AND theCenter must not be null AND theColor must not be null

        Parameters:
        theRadius - the radius to assign to this Circle
        theCenter - the center point to assign to this Circle
        theColor - the color to assign to this Circle
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if theRadius <= 0 OR theCenter is null OR theColor is null

      • Circle

        public Circle()
        Constructs a black unit circle centered at the origin.

    • Method Detail

      • setRadius

        public final void setRadius(double theRadius)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the radius of this Circle to the specified value.

        Precondition: theRadius must be greater than 0

        Postcondition: this Circle will be assigned the specified radius

        Parameters:
        theRadius - the radius value to assign to this Circle
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if theRadius <= 0

      • setCenter

        public final void setCenter(java.awt.Point thePoint)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the center of this Circle to the specified point.

        Precondition: thePoint must not be null

        Postcondition: this Circle will be assigned the specified center Point

        Parameters:
        thePoint - the center value to assign to this Circle
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if thePoint is null

      • setColor

        public final void setColor(java.awt.Color theColor)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the Color of this Circle to the specified value.

        Precondition: theColor must not be null

        Postcondition: this Circle will be assigned the specified Color

        Parameters:
        theColor - the Color value to assign to this Circle
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if theColor is null
